rawFirstEdition: ELder en womonit Gaius, noh womonog ut wunnamuhkuteyeuuk.
rawSecondEdition: ELder en womonit Gaius, noh womonog ut wunnamuhkuteyeuuk.
comparedFirstEdition: ELder en womonit Gaius, noh womonog ut wunnamuhkuteyeuuk.
comparedSecondEdition: ELder en womonit Gaius, noh womonog ut wunnamuhkuteyeuuk.
caseInsensitiveFirst: ELder en womonit Gaius, noh womonog ut wunnamuhkuteyeuuk.
caseInsensitiveSecond: ELder en womonit Gaius, noh womonog ut wunnamuhkuteyeuuk.
rawKJV: The elder unto the well beloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.
grebrew: Ὁ πρεσβύτερος Γαΐῳ τῷ ἀγαπητῷ, ὃν ἐγὼ ἀγαπῶ ἐν ἀληθείᾳ.

rawFirstEdition: Womonun, nꝏ̄wehquetum ánue onk wame woh kꝏ̄niinneat, kah woh kꝏ̄ne pomantamunat, neyan wunne pomantog kukketeahogkou.
rawSecondEdition: Womonun, nꝏ̄wehquetum ánue onk wame woh kꝏ̄niinneat, kah woh kꝏ̄ne pomantamunat, neyan wunne pomantog kukketeahogkou,

caseInsensitiveSecond: Womonun, nꝏ̄wehquetum ánue onk wame woh kꝏ̄niinneat, kah woh kꝏ̄ne pomantamunat, neyan wunne pomantog kukketeahogkou,
rawKJV: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
grebrew: Ἀγαπητέ, περὶ πάντων εὔχομαί σε εὐοδοῦσθαι καὶ ὑγιαίνειν, καθὼς εὐοδοῦταί σου ἡ ψυχή.

rawFirstEdition: Newutche «nummishewekontamup», ꝏ̄wemattinneunk paahettit, kah wauwahettit wunnamuhkuteyeuuk ne apehtunkquean, neyane ‹pomushaán› wunnamuhkuteyeuut.
rawSecondEdition: Newutch nummishe wekontamup, ꝏ̄wemattinneunk paahettit, kah wauwahettit wunnamuhkuteyeuuk ne apehtunkquean, neyane ‹pomusháan› wunnamuhkuteyeuut.

rawKJV: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.
grebrew: Ἐχάρην γὰρ λίαν, ἐρχομένων ἀδελφῶν καὶ μαρτυρούντων σου τῇ ἀληθείᾳ, καθὼς σὺ ἐν ἀληθείᾳ περιπατεῖς.

rawFirstEdition: Wanne nutánue mishewekontamꝏ̄, onk nꝏ̄tamon «nummukkiyeumog» ‹pomushaontamwog› wunnámuhkuteyeuꝏ̄uk.
rawSecondEdition: Wanne nutánue mishewekontamꝏ̄, onk nꝏ̄tamon «nummukiyeumog» ‹pómushaontamwog› wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄uk.
comparedFirstEdition: Wanne nutánue mishewekontamꝏ̄, onk nꝏ̄tamon «nummukkiyeumog» ‹pomushaontamwog› wunnámuhkuteyeuꝏ̄uk.
comparedSecondEdition: Wanne nutánue mishewekontamꝏ̄, onk nꝏ̄tamon «nummukiyeumog» ‹pómushaontamwog› wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄uk.

rawKJV: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.
grebrew: Μειζοτέραν τούτων οὐκ ἔχω χαράν ἵνα ἀκούω τὰ ἐμὰ τέκνα ἐν ἀληθείᾳ περιπατοῦντα.

comparedFirstEdition: Womonog kuppaubuhtanumukqus uttoh anheadt ‹wemattiñeunk›, & penuwohteaog
comparedSecondEdition: Womonog ‹kúppaubuhtanumukqus› uttoh anheadt ‹wemáttinneunk›, & «penuwoteaog »
caseInsensitiveFirst: Womonog kuppaubuhtanumukqus uttoh anheadt ‹wemattiñeunk›, & penuwohteaog
caseInsensitiveSecond: Womonog ‹kúppaubuhtanumukqus› uttoh anheadt ‹wemáttinneunk›, & «penuwoteaog »
rawKJV: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;
grebrew: Ἀγαπητέ, πιστὸν ποιεῖς ὃ ἐὰν ἐργάσῃ εἰς τοὺς ἀδελφοὺς, καὶ εἰς τοὺς ξένους·

rawFirstEdition: Neg ‹wauwachég› kꝏ̄womoausuonk, anaquabhettit moeuwehkomonk: nag pasꝏ̄ad uppomushaonganꝏ̄óut tapeneunkqussinneat ut Godut, kꝏ̄nesem.
rawSecondEdition: Neg wauwacheg ‹kꝏ̄wómoausuonk› anaquabhettit moeuwehkomonk: nag pasꝏ̄ad uppomushaonganꝏ̄óut tapeneunkqussinneat ut Godut, kꝏ̄nesem.
comparedFirstEdition: Neg ‹wauwachég› kꝏ̄womoausuonk, anaquabhettit moeuwehkomonk: nag pasꝏ̄ad uppomushaonganꝏ̄óut tapeneunkqussinneat ut Godut, kꝏ̄nesem.

rawKJV: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after «a» godly sort, thou shalt do well:
grebrew: Οἳ ἐμαρτύρησάν σου τῇ ἀγάπῃ ἐνώπιον ἐκκλησίας: οὓς καλῶς ποιήσεις: προπέμψας ἀξίως τοῦ Θεοῦ,

rawFirstEdition: Newutche, wutche ꝏ̄wesuonk sohhamwog, wanne teag «wunnemunnumóunnaóut» wutch gentilsut.
rawSecondEdition: Newutche, wutche ꝏ̄wesuonk ‹sohhámwog›, wanne teag «wunnemunumóunnaóut» wutch gentilsut.
comparedFirstEdition: Newutche, wutche ꝏ̄wesuonk sohhamwog, wanne teag «wunnemunnumóunnaóut» wutch gentilsut.
comparedSecondEdition: Newutche, wutche ꝏ̄wesuonk ‹sohhámwog›, wanne teag «wunnemunumóunnaóut» wutch gentilsut.

caseInsensitiveSecond: Newutche, wutche ꝏ̄wesuonk ‹sohhámwog›, wanne teag «wunnemunumóunnaóut» wutch gentilsut.
rawKJV: Because that for his name's sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
grebrew: Ὑπὲρ γὰρ τοῦ ὀνόματος αὐτοῦ ἐξῆλθον, μηδὲν λαμβάνοντες ἀπὸ τῶν Ἐθνῶν.

rawFirstEdition: Newutche, woh neg attumunogkut, onk woh kꝏ̄weeche «anummoadtinnean» ut wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄ut.
rawSecondEdition: Newutche, woh neg attumunogkut, onk woh kꝏ̄weeche «aninnummoadtinnean» ut wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄ut.

rawKJV: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.
grebrew: Ἡμεῖς οὖν ὀφείλομεν ἀπολαμβάνειν τοὺς τοιούτους, ἵνα συνεργοὶ γινώμεθα τῇ ἀληθείᾳ.

rawFirstEdition:
Nꝏ̄sukkuhhumau moeuwehkomonk, qut Diotrephes, noh womontog kehcheáyeuonk kenugke nahog, matta «nutáttumunukꝏ̄un.
»
rawSecondEdition:
Nꝏ̄sukkuhhumau moeuwehkomonk, qut Diotrephes, noh womontog kehcheáyeuonk kenugke nagog, matta «nutatumunukꝏ̄un.
»
comparedFirstEdition: Nꝏ̄sukkuhhumau moeuwehkomonk, qut Diotrephes, noh womontog kehcheáyeuonk kenugke nahog, matta «nutáttumunukꝏ̄un. »

rawKJV:
I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us «not.
»
grebrew: Ἔγραψά τῇ ἐκκλησίᾳ: ἀλλʼ ὁ <u>φιλοπρωτεύων</u> αὐτῶν, <u>Διοτρέφης</u>, οὐκ ἐπιδέχεται ἡμᾶς.

rawFirstEdition:
Newutche peyôon, pish nummehquontam wutusseongash nish asechish, mamatchenukqueog ishkauanittue kuttꝏ̄wongash, kàh yeu matta «wuttaphikꝏ̄un», nagum mátta attumunóou ꝏ̄wemattinneuh, kah ukquihtinuh nah unnánuttamunutcheh, kah wussohwhuhkonuh wutch ‹moéuwehkomonganit.
›
rawSecondEdition:
Newutche peyaon, pish nummehquontam wutusseongash nish asechish, mamatchenukqueog ishkauanittue kuttꝏ̄wongash, kah yeu matta «wutaphikꝏ̄un», nagum matta attumunóou ‹ꝏ̄wéemattinneuh›, kah ukquihtinuh nah unnánuttamunutcheh, kah wussohwhuhkonuh wutch ‹moéuwehkomongánit.
›

rawKJV: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and «not» content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.
grebrew: Διὰ τοῦτο, ἐὰν ἔλθω, ὑπομνήσω αὐτοῦ τὰ ἔργα ἃ ποιεῖ, λόγοις πονηροῖς <u>φλυαρῶν</u> ἡμᾶς: καὶ μὴ ἀρκούμενος ἐπὶ τούτοις, οὔτε αὐτὸς ἐπιδέχεται τοὺς ἀδελφοὺς, καὶ τοὺς βουλομένους κωλύει, καὶ ἐκ τῆς ἐκκλησίας ἐκβάλλει.

rawFirstEdition: Womonog ahque ‹asúhkash› ne machuk, qut ne wanegik, noh waneseit noh wutcháyeu Godut, qut noh asit matcheseonk matta nauóou Goduh.
rawSecondEdition: Womonog ahque asuhkash ne machuk, qut ne wanegik, noh waneseit noh wutcháyeu Godut, qut noh ásit matcheseonk matta nauóou Goduh,

caseInsensitiveSecond: Womonog ahque asuhkash ne machuk, qut ne wanegik, noh waneseit noh wutcháyeu Godut, qut noh ásit matcheseonk matta nauóou Goduh,
rawKJV: Beloved, follow «not» that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath «not» seen God.
grebrew: Ἀγαπητέ, μὴ μιμοῦ τὸ κακὸν, ἀλλὰ τὸ ἀγαθόν. Ὁ ἀγαθοποιῶν ἐκ τοῦ Θεοῦ ἐστιν: ὁ δὲ κακοποιῶν οὐχ ἑώρακεν τὸν Θεόν.

rawFirstEdition: Demetrius «waeenomuk» wame wosketompuh, kah ne wanumuhkuteyeuuk, nux, nenawun wonk nꝏ̄wauwamun, kah kꝏ̄wahteauunneau nꝏ̄wauwaonganun wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄.
rawSecondEdition: Demetrius «waenoumuk» wame wosketompuh, kah ne wanumuhkuteyeuuk, nux, nenawun wonk nꝏ̄wauwamun, kah kꝏ̄wahteauunneau nꝏ̄wauwaonganun wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄.
comparedFirstEdition: Demetrius «waeenomuk» wame wosketompuh, kah ne wanumuhkuteyeuuk, nux, nenawun wonk nꝏ̄wauwamun, kah kꝏ̄wahteauunneau nꝏ̄wauwaonganun wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄.

caseInsensitiveFirst: Demetrius «waeenomuk» wame wosketompuh, kah ne wanumuhkuteyeuuk, nux, nenawun wonk nꝏ̄wauwamun, kah kꝏ̄wahteauunneau nꝏ̄wauwaonganun wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄.
caseInsensitiveSecond: Demetrius «waenoumuk» wame wosketompuh, kah ne wanumuhkuteyeuuk, nux, nenawun wonk nꝏ̄wauwamun, kah kꝏ̄wahteauunneau nꝏ̄wauwaonganun wunnamuhkuteyeuꝏ̄.
rawKJV: Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.
grebrew: Δημητρίῳ μεμαρτύρηται ὑπὸ πάντων, καὶ ὑπʼ αὐτῆς τῆς ἀληθείας: καὶ ἡμεῖς δὲ μαρτυροῦμεν· καὶ οἴδατε ὅτι ἡ μαρτυρία ἡμῶν ἀληθής ἐστιν.

rawFirstEdition: Monatash woh nꝏ̄sukkuhhum, qut matta «kꝏ̄sukkuhhumaúunꝏ̄» nashpe ink kah mequn:
rawSecondEdition: Monatash woh nꝏ̄sukuhhum, qut matta «kꝏ̄sukhuhhumauunꝏ̄» nashpe ink kah mequn.
comparedFirstEdition: Monatash woh nꝏ̄sukkuhhum, qut matta «kꝏ̄sukkuhhumaúunꝏ̄» nashpe ink kah mequn:
comparedSecondEdition: Monatash woh nꝏ̄sukuhhum, qut matta «kꝏ̄sukhuhhumauunꝏ̄» nashpe ink kah mequn.
caseInsensitiveFirst: Monatash woh nꝏ̄sukkuhhum, qut matta «kꝏ̄sukkuhhumaúunꝏ̄» nashpe ink kah mequn:
caseInsensitiveSecond: Monatash woh nꝏ̄sukuhhum, qut matta «kꝏ̄sukhuhhumauunꝏ̄» nashpe ink kah mequn.
rawKJV: I had many things to write, but I will «not» with ink and pen write unto thee:
grebrew: Πολλὰ εἶχον γράφειν, ἀλλʼ οὐ θέλω διὰ μέλανος καὶ καλάμου σοι γράψαι:

rawFirstEdition: Qut «nutannóous» pish kenauush paswe, kah pish «kenꝏ̄nittimun» kuskesukqunnónut. Wunohteash, neetohteamunganun kꝏ̄wonkomukꝏ̄, wesuongane wonkum neetatteamunganunnónog.
rawSecondEdition: Qut ‹nutannóus› pish kenauush paswe, kah pish «kukkenꝏ̄nìttimun» ‹kuskesukqunnonut›. Wunohteash, neetohteamunganun kꝏ̄wonkomukꝏ̄, wesuongane wonkum neetatteamunganunnónog.
comparedFirstEdition: Qut «nutannóous» pish kenauush paswe, kah pish «kenꝏ̄nittimun» kuskesukqunnónut. Wunohteash, neetohteamunganun kꝏ̄wonkomukꝏ̄, wesuongane wonkum neetatteamunganunnónog.
comparedSecondEdition: Qut ‹nutannóus› pish kenauush paswe, kah pish «kukkenꝏ̄nìttimun» ‹kuskesukqunnonut›. Wunohteash, neetohteamunganun kꝏ̄wonkomukꝏ̄, wesuongane wonkum neetatteamunganunnónog.

caseInsensitiveSecond: Qut ‹nutannóus› pish kenauush paswe, kah pish «kukkenꝏ̄nìttimun» ‹kuskesukqunnonut›. Wunohteash, neetohteamunganun kꝏ̄wonkomukꝏ̄, wesuongane wonkum neetatteamunganunnónog.
rawKJV: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be to thee. Our friends salute thee. Greet the friends by name.
grebrew: Ἐλπίζω δὲ εὐθέως ἰδεῖν σε, καὶ στόμα πρὸς στόμα λαλήσομεν.
